fact: Paradise has eight gates.
The width of Paradise is like the heavens and the earth combined.
Its soil is of saffron and musk.
Its pebbles are pearls and rubies.
There are rivers of water, milk, wine, and honey.
There are no ill speech or idle talk in Paradise.
People of Paradise will be young and hairless (around age 33).
People of Paradise will never grow old.
People of Paradise will never fall ill or die.
They will have everlasting youth and beauty.
They will have whatever they desire.
They will be given fruits and meat as they desire.
They will wear garments of silk and brocade.
They will wear bracelets of gold and pearls.
They will recline on raised couches.
They will be served by youthful servants.
There will be no envy, hatred, or grudges.
They will greet each other with peace.
They will see their Lord (Allah) in Paradise.
They will never feel tired or exhausted.
They will dwell there forever.
They will have palaces made of gold and silver bricks.
They will have tents made from hollowed pearls.
Each believer will have two wives from the houris.
The houris are pure, untouched companions.
The lowest person in Paradise will have ten times the like of this world.
The highest rank is Al-Firdaws (the middle and highest part of Paradise).
There is a tree whose shade covers a distance of 100 years travel.
Their hearts will be like one heart with no hatred.
They will have everlasting bliss and happiness.
They will be given pure wine that causes no headache or intoxication.
They will be seated on thrones facing each other.
They will forget worldly sorrows completely.
They will experience no urine, stool, mucus, or impurity.
They will sweat musk instead of perspiration.
They will have eternal security and safety.
They will have rivers flowing beneath their palaces.
They will be honored and not humiliated.
They will dwell in gardens of delight.
They will have fruits that are easy to pick.
They will be free from fear and grief.
They will be welcomed by angels with greetings of peace.
Their faces will be shining with joy.
They will be granted more than they can imagine.
They will live in lofty dwellings built one above another.
They will enjoy eternal companionship and love.
They will never be expelled or removed.
They will experience no poverty or scarcity.
The greatest blessing in Paradise is seeing Allah.
They will have whatever they desire.
They will be given fruits in abundance.
They will drink from sealed nectar whose last aroma is musk.
They will recline on raised thrones lined with gold and jewels.
They will wear garments of silk and brocade.
They will wear bracelets of gold and pearls.
They will have radiant faces full of joy.
They will never experience hunger or thirst.
They will never be touched by fatigue or toil.
They will greet each other with peace (salam).
Angels will enter upon them from every gate greeting with peace.
The lowest ranking person in Paradise will have ten times the like of this world.
The highest level is Al-Firdaws, directly beneath the Throne of Allah.
The believer's tent will be a hollowed pearl sixty miles wide.
In Paradise there is a market where people meet every Friday.
Their hearts will be as one, no hatred or jealousy among them.
They will remember their worldly lives as if it was only a moment.
They will laugh and rejoice with companions.
They will be served by youthful servants like scattered pearls.
They will recline facing each other in joy.
They will eat and drink without needing to excrete.
They will glorify Allah as naturally as breathing.
They will have palaces made of gold and silver bricks.
They will have trees whose shade spans a hundred years' journey.
The fruit of Paradise hangs low and is easy to reach.
They will be given pure spouses (Hur al-'Ayn).
They will be married to the most beautiful companions.
There is no hatred, sadness, or grief in Paradise.
They will live eternally with no death.
They will be close to their righteous family members.
They will be with the Prophets, martyrs, and the righteous.
They will have rivers flowing beneath their dwellings.
They will have golden vessels and cups passed among them.
They will never experience fear or sorrow.
They will be honored and exalted by Allah.
They will see Allah with their own eyes.
The greatest blessing in Paradise is the pleasure of Allah.
Their ranks will differ according to their deeds.
They will be rewarded for even the smallest good deeds.
There is no marketplace of buying and selling except exchanging joy and memories.
The space of a whip in Paradise is better than the whole world.
Paradise is surrounded by hardships.
The first to enter Paradise will be the Prophet Muhammad ﷺ.
The poor of the Ummah will enter Paradise before the rich by 500 years.
Every person will have two wives from the hur al-'ayn.
There will be no menstruation, childbirth, or impurity in Paradise.
People will have the strength of 100 men in intimacy.
The believers will enter Paradise in groups according to their deeds.
